name: Hardest The Retriever Breeds Trivia Quiz | Dog Breeds | 10 Questions

questions.text: This retriever breed has been the most popular dog in the United States for well over a decade. Originally developed in Canada, the breed was refined in England and is now the top dog in field trials worldwide.
questions.explanation:
Labrador retriever.

	Labradors are hearty dogs. Good ones have an uncrushable working ethic and live to retrieve.

questions.text: Known for its gentle nature and easy trainability, this beautiful retriever has suffered greatly from indiscriminate breeding. Poorly-bred ones now are likely to suffer from hip dysplasia, heart defects, temperament problems, allergies, and many other problems.
questions.explanation:
Golden retriever.

	The gentle and lovable Golden doesn't deserve such a fate. Any Golden breeder should screen all breeding stock for hip dysplasia, eye disorders, heart defects and hypothyroidism, and buyers should demand proof of such checks.

questions.text: Once the darling of both gamekeepers and the English aristocracy, this handsome breed is now quite rare. However, it is as versatile as ever- no other sporting breed comes close to it in the number of titles earned per dog.
questions.explanation:
Flat-coated retriever.

	Among other things, flat-coats excel at obedience, agility, flyball and hunt tests. Across all dog breeds, only border collies and Belgian Tervurens earn more titles per dog.

questions.text: This rare beauty is popular in New Zealand. People may mistake it for some kind of poodle, but it's a true retriever through and through.
questions.explanation:
Curly-coated retriever.

	Curlies have a tight curled coat. They do shed, however.

questions.text: This American native, first bred to haul in ducks and geese for market hunters, has a wavy coat in one of three colors- brown, sedge or deadgrass.
questions.explanation:
Chesapeake Bay retriever.

	The colors range from a chocolate brown to a light yellow. Chessies are very hardy dogs and can easily tolerate swimming in icy water.

questions.text: This Canadian dog that resembles a red fox is the smallest of all retrievers.
questions.explanation:
Nova Scotia duck tolling retriever.

	"Tolling" refers to the hunter's practice of throwing a stick or ball for the dog to retrieve. The dog's sprightly movement and flashy markings would attract ducks, which the hunter would then flush and shoot.

questions.text: Which retriever breed is the most likely to also be trainable for protection work?
questions.explanation:
Chesapeake Bay retriever.

	Chessies can be intensely protective dogs. They were trained to guard the boats and catches of their masters.

questions.text: Which retriever breed is known for its "otter tail"?
questions.explanation:
Labrador retriever.

	A properly-bred Lab should have a thick and relatively short tail that acts as a rudder while swimming.

questions.text: By what affectionate nickname is the Nova Scotia duck tolling retriever usually known?
questions.explanation:
Toller.

	You have to admit that "Nova Scotia duck tolling retriever" is a bit too much of a mouthful to roll off of the tongue!

questions.text: Which of these retriever breeds is the oldest?
questions.explanation:
Curly-coated retriever.

	The Curly was developed in the mid-1800s in England. The flat-coat was developed a few years later. Goldens have flat-coats as their immediate ancestors. The modern Lab was developed in the early 1900s.
